column4: why does it take so much time packing programs for ubuntu? like.. repositories
Programs don't get released for ubuntu after releases. Not official ones.
So why don't you take it on yourself to install beta 5? I did...

Ubuntu has a strict set of rules for what packages get though. Packaging GAIM in a reliable and bugfree state is tricky, they can't just scrap that process the moment a new version comes out a day before an ubuntu release.
GAIM was stable & very bug free in dapper. If you wanted complete bug-free hand holding stay with dapper.
Commands are run like this: command
you just run the commands from a .sh script?
why do they use & in the end in this script?
& is for redirecting output I think.... I'm not sure. Ask the people in #bash, I never really was a good shell scripter
